topics.content: Nutrients are substances present in food that are needed by the body for energy, growth, and health.
Carbohydrates provide energy to the body and are mainly found in rice, wheat, and potatoes.
Proteins help in growth and repair of the body and are found in pulses, milk, and eggs.
Fats provide energy and help keep the body warm.
A balanced diet contains all nutrients in proper amounts required for good health.
Objects are things we see around us and materials are substances from which objects are made.
Materials have properties like color, hardness, solubility, and transparency.
Soluble substances dissolve in water, while insoluble substances do not.
Transparent materials allow light to pass, translucent allow partial light, and opaque do not allow light.
Separation is needed to remove unwanted substances or obtain useful components.
Handpicking is the method of separating larger unwanted particles by hand.
Sieving separates particles of different sizes using a sieve.
Sedimentation allows heavy particles to settle, and decantation is pouring out clear liquid.
Herbs have soft stems, shrubs have woody stems, and trees are tall with strong trunks.
Plants have roots, stems, leaves, flowers, fruits, and seeds.
Roots absorb water and minerals and hold the plant firmly in soil.
Photosynthesis is the process by which plants make food using sunlight, water, carbon dioxide, and chlorophyll.
The skeleton gives shape, support, and protection to the body.
Joints are places where two bones meet and allow movement.
Different joints allow different movements like bending, rotating, and sliding.
Living things grow, breathe, and reproduce, while non-living things do not.
A habitat is the place where an organism lives.
Adaptation is the ability of organisms to survive in their surroundings.
Motion is the change in position of an object with time.
Motion can be straight, circular, or periodic.
Length is measured using standard units like meter and centimeter.
Objects that produce light are called sources of light.
Shadows are formed when light is blocked by an opaque object.
Reflection is the bouncing back of light from a surface.
An electric cell produces electricity using chemicals.
An electric circuit is a complete path through which current flows.
A switch is used to open or close an electric circuit.
A magnet is an object that attracts materials like iron.
Magnetic materials are attracted by magnets, non-magnetic materials are not.
Magnets have two poles called north and south poles.
Air contains gases like nitrogen, oxygen, carbon dioxide, and water vapor.
Air is essential for breathing, burning, and plant growth.
Air supports life on Earth and helps regulate temperature.
